meanings.definition: A person who follows another in an office or position.
meanings.sent1: After the principal retired, the new successor took over the school.
meanings.sent2: The successor to the throne was announced after the king's passing.
meanings.sent3: The successor to the mayor's office was a talking parrot - quite a surprise!
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur saw his mentor as a guiding light, his successor in the making.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, the pawn dreams of becoming the powerful successor, the queen.

meanings.definition: Something that comes after or replaces something else.
meanings.sent1: The successor to the old computer was a sleek new model.
meanings.sent2: The successor to the outdated law brought much-needed change.
meanings.sent3: The successor to the broken vase was a quirky rubber duck - an interesting choice!
meanings.sent4: The rising sun was the natural successor to the darkness of night.
meanings.sent5: The blooming flower was the beautiful successor to the closed bud.
